page.title: 14Leabrook.
page.content: This area is partly residential and partly industrial. There are two canals which meet near the centre of the square. South and West of the canals is a large housing estate which leads into the Eastern edge of Burberry Grange estate, built in 1983. In the North West is the{British Rail {Steel Terminal.}Further North is mostly waste land, and includes the recently closed{Patent Shaft factory.} The name of the factory, which was a large employer in the area, lives on in the name of the local public house {The Shaft.}Near to the works is the grave of{William Arthur Burton}who was born in 1925 and committed suicide in 1956. The factory he owned is named after him{William Burton, Chemical } {engineers.}He was also the founder and chairman of{Prodorite Limited.}
